mentalHealthQuotes.text: Your mental health is a priority. Your happiness is essential. Your self-care is a necessity.
mentalHealthQuotes.author: Unknown

mentalHealthQuotes.text: It's okay to not be okay. It's okay to ask for help. It's okay to take a break.
mentalHealthQuotes.author: Unknown

checkinPrompt.title: How are you feeling today?
checkinPrompt.noCheckin: Take a moment to check in with your emotions

mood.checkinSuccess: Thanks for checking in! Your mood has been recorded as {{mood}}.

moodModal.title: How are you feeling?
moodModal.notesPlaceholder: Add any context about your mood...

90: Your positive energy is great! Consider journaling about what's making you happy.
Share your good mood with others - it can be contagious!
Take advantage of this positive energy to tackle something challenging.
70: It's great that you're feeling good! Maybe try some light exercise to maintain this mood.
Consider connecting with friends or family to share your positive vibes.
Practice gratitude - write down three things you're thankful for today.
50: Sometimes neutral days are opportunities for self-reflection.
Try a short mindfulness exercise to center yourself.
A brief walk outside might help improve your mood.
30: Be gentle with yourself today. It's okay to not feel great all the time.
Consider talking to someone you trust about how you're feeling.
Simple self-care activities like a warm drink or favorite music might help.
10: Remember that difficult feelings are temporary, even when they don't feel that way.
Consider reaching out to your support network or counselor.
Try a grounding exercise: name 5 things you can see, 4 you can touch, 3 you can hear, 2 you can smell, and 1 you can taste.

hero.title: Welcome to
hero.subtitle: Your mental health support platform designed to help college students navigate

stressManagement.title: Stress Management
stressManagement.description: Learn techniques to manage academic pressure and reduce anxiety with our guided exercises.

communitySupport.title: Community Support
communitySupport.description: Connect with peers who understand what you're going through in a safe, moderated environment.

mindfulness.title: Mindfulness Exercises
mindfulness.description: Practice mindfulness with our curated meditation sessions designed specifically for students.

testimonials.text: MindEase helped me navigate my toughest semester. The breathing exercises became my daily ritual before studying.
testimonials.author: Psychology Major, Junior

testimonials.text: The community support here is incredible. I finally found people who understand what I'm going through.
testimonials.author: Engineering Student, Sophomore

testimonials.text: As an international student, MindEase provided me with tools to manage homesickness and academic pressure.
testimonials.author: International Student, Senior

testimonials.text: The mindfulness exercises have transformed how I handle stress. I'm more focused and less anxious during exams.
testimonials.author: Pre-Med Student, Junior

testimonials.text: I was hesitant at first, but the resources here genuinely helped with my burnout. Wish I found this earlier!
testimonials.author: Graduate Student, 2nd Year

testimonials.text: The anonymous support groups made me feel safe to share my struggles without judgment. Thank you, MindEase!
testimonials.author: Business Major, Freshman

about.title: About MindEase
about.paragraph1: MindEase was founded in 2020 by a team of psychologists, educators, and software developers who recognized the growing mental health challenges facing college students.
about.paragraph2: Our mission is to provide accessible, evidence-based mental health support to students everywhere. We combine therapeutic techniques with modern technology to create a platform that's both effective and engaging.
about.paragraph3: All our resources are developed in collaboration with licensed mental health professionals and are regularly updated based on the latest research in psychology and neuroscience.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Have questions or want to learn more about how MindEase can support your campus community? Reach out to our team.
